entry.title: Unknown Rfam Puzzles First Round Closed
entry.content:
The first round of the “Unknown Rfam Puzzles” has been closed now. The prediction results will be released soon (the release will be within RNA-Puzzles community). Further prediction submissions are still very welcome. We would like to encourage experimentalists to help validate some of the good predictions.

A detailed time table for the “Unknown Rfam Puzzles” is available through google doc.

entry.title: New Domain Name
entry.content:
RNA-Puzzles has a new domain name rnapuzzles.org. This domain name will always point to the RNA-Puzzles website no matter where we set the domain. Currently, the website is fully functional except the registration system. Therefore, the submission of the prediction results need to be done by email.

Please feel free to contact Chichau if you have any question about RNA-Puzzles.

entry.title: New RNA-Puzzles Website at Github
entry.content:
Considering the unstability of the old RNA-Puzzles web server (ahsoka), a new low-level RNA-Puzzzles website has been release at github. Alternatively, the website can be accessed by rnapuzzles.tk.

Further, we have released the results of Puzzle 21, the Guanidine III Riboswitch.

Best Wishes!

Chichau

entry.title: Puzzle 21
entry.content:
Sequence (5' to 3'):

CCGGACGAGGUGCGCCGUACCCGGUCAGGACAAGACGGCGC

Puzzle: Guanidine III Riboswitch

Crystal structure kindly provided by: David M J Lilley

Reference: Structure of the Guanidine III Riboswitch. Cell Chem Biol. 2017 Nov 16;24(11):1407-1415.e2. doi: 10.1016/j.chembiol.2017.08.021. Epub 2017 Oct 5.

PDB id: 5nwq 5nz6

raw prediction | Assessment results

Puzzle: Zika virus.

Crystal structure kindly provided by: Jeffrey S. Kieft

Reference: Zika virus produces noncoding RNAs using a multi-pseudoknot structure that confounds a cellular exonuclease. (2016) Science 354: 1148-1152. DOI: 10.1126/science.aah3963.

PDB id: 5tpy

entry.title: Puzzle 15
entry.content:
Sequence (5' to 3'): GGGUACUUAAGCCCACUGAUGAGUCGCUGGGAUGCGACGAAACGCCCA- GGGCGUCUGGGCAGUACCCA

Puzzle: Hammerhead Ribozyme. Predict as 2 chains.

Crystal structure kindly provided by: Barbara L. Golden

Reference: Two Active Site Divalent Ions in the Crystal Structure of the Hammerhead Ribozyme Bound to a Transition State Analogue. Biochemistry, 2016, 55 (4), pp 633–636 DOI: 10.1021/acs.biochem.5b01139.

PDB id: 5di4

raw prediction | Assessment results

entry.title: Puzzle 14 Free Form
entry.content:
Sequence (5' to 3'):
Bound form:
CGUUGACCCAGGAAACUGGGCGGAAGUAAGGCCCAUUGCACUCCGGGCCUGAAG CAACGCG
Free form:
CGUUGGCCCAGGAAACUGGGUGGAAGUAAGGCCCAUUGCACUCCGGGCCUGAAG CAACGCU

Puzzle: L-glutamine riboswitch. Predict both Free and Bound forms.

Crystal structure kindly provided by: Dinshaw Patel

Reference: Aiming Ren, Yi Xue, Alla Peselis, Alexander Serganov, Hashim M. Al-Hashimi, Dinshaw J. Patel. Structural and Dynamic Basis for Low-Affinity, High- Selectivity Binding of L-Glutamine by the Glutamine Riboswitch. Cell Rep. 2015 Dec 1;13(9):1800-13.01251-6)

PDB id: 5ddo

raw prediction | Assessment results
